what can i say ? it 's the top brand aluminum foil . not flimsy . it 's the most convenient lining for a pan that you do n't want to scrub , and the easiest way to wrap odd - shaped foods like cooked meats and pieces of cake . i 've crushed it up to make dryer balls because it helps reduce static in the winter . however , i 'm trying to use less aluminum for cooking because of a suspected connection between aluminum ingestion and alzheimer 's disease . i recently began lining my aluminum pans for reheating foods in the oven with parchment paper , and am working my way up to roasting in parchment , and in pyrex glass pans ( with the scrubbing required ) . i have begun wrapping sandwiches for lunch in waxed paper with a piece of tape , just like an old - style deli , or using a rubber band . i am leary of using cling wrap because it leaches polyvinyl chloride into food .

i tried the new detergent first on whites . i put a load of white clothes in my top - loading washer followed by about half a measuring cup of the powder . i used the cold - cold cycle as i do for my usual liquid detergent . the clothes emerged clean . it was not clear to me whether they were more or less clean or softer , but the powder did work . i next tried a load of dark clothes . the results were comparable to the whites . the package does say that the detergent contains no phosphates . this is important . all of our used water eventually finds its way back into our streams and lakes . phosphates are a fertilizer for algae growth , which uses up the oxygen in the water and eventually kills everything else . if you can wash your clothes without adding to the phosphorous in the water supply , that is a plus .

i love mccormick spices , and i have tried a number of their blends over the years . this is actually my first time trying their perfect pinch cajun seasoning , and i was pretty surprised . as a southerner , i enjoy cajun food , and i naturally assumed that a company like mccormick would have a hard time actually capturing a spicy flavor that i would consider good enough for our table . while i know that some of my local foodie friends would declare this not to be " cajun " at all , i would describe it as a very flavorful blend with a relatively mild kick . there is definitely some red pepper and paprika present , along with a little garlic flavor that overall makes this a surprising delicious ( and versatile ) spice blend . thus far , i have tried this on pizza , vegetables , shrimp , and chicken , and i would say that it works quite well as an everyday seasoning for the table . i have not yet cooked with it , and i am not sure i would actually . this seems like the kind of blend that you use to accent a dish just before eating . overall , i was surprised by this , and by that i mean that i was very pleasantly surprised . this is a worthwhile addition to our spice cabinet ( and dining room table ) .

these chips are about the size of the head of a spoon , which makes them easy to use . if you have a very thick or heavy type of dip , you must use these chips instead of thinner kinds so that they will not break off in the dip . i personally use these for thin dips , salsa , or heavy dips like bean dips . these chips are thicker than the original tostitos chips because they are designed for use with heavy dips . i recommend that you do not try to eat these chips in one bite or you might hurt your mouth - eat one half first and then the other half . these are superior to traditional tortilla chips because these chips are sturdier than any other variety on the market . a bag this size will likely be enough for at least qqq average sized people ( or two if they are extremely hungry ) . they are not very salty like other chips so you wo n't burn your mouth if you eat a lot of them . this is a must have for any party and your partygoers will be unhappy if you do not have them . my favorite part of tostitos chip bags are that unlike other types of chips , these bags cone packed fairly full , and therefore you get less air and more chips . at such a nominal price and with the option of having these shipped straight to your door , there is no good excuse not to buy these . this product comes highly recommended by me !

i was happy to see that happy belly coffee was expanding its coffee line , especially since i have been drinking their breakfast blend for some time . i enjoyed this new brew , but it is not for everyone . coffee drinkers can be very critical of decafs because basically they tend to be less strong than their caffeinated brethren . this is true for this italian roast , but for me less is more - for me , " strong decaf " has always been an oxymoron . in fact , i usually avoid really strong and robust coffees , instead favoring mild low acid blends . happy belly italian roast gives me a satisfying replacement for my dark roast regular coffee . it is made of organic arabica beans with a slight addition of cloves , tapioca and dark chocolate . these beans are also water processed rather than chemically decaffeinated . this happy belly coffee , like most , if not all , are fair trade and usda organic . the beans come from south and central america . this coffee is great for an everyday experience and i would not hesitate to purchase it again when looking for a quality decaf coffee at a reasonable price .
